Template Notes

Notes for Feature Engineering Course

Author

Adrián Cidre González

Published

December 26, 2023

Contenidos

  • 1 Quarto
  • 2 Running Code

1 Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

2 Running Code

When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

library(pacman)

p_load(tidyverse, gghighlight, geomtextpath, scales, ggtext)

You can add options to executable code like this

set.seed(666)
selected_countries <- gapminder::gapminder |> 
  janitor::clean_names() |> 
  filter(
    year %in% c(1952, 2007),
    country %in% c(
      sample(levels(gapminder::gapminder$country), 15), 
      'Zimbabwe'
    )
  ) |> 
  mutate(
    year = factor(year),
    country = factor(country, levels = unique(country)) # reset levels
  )
selected_countries
# A tibble: 32 × 6

The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
